attributes.action: Abolish Naturalisation & British Passport fee if permanent resident last 15years
attributes.background: For a foreign national who's lived lawfully and permanently with indefinite residency status in the UK for 15years or more, it's unreasonable to charge them £2357 in fee for Naturalisation and for a British Passport.  This wrongly discourages good & long established residents from becoming British.
attributes.additional_details: As an individual who's been permanently & indefinitely resident in the UK 22years to date and has lived in the UK for a total 33years to date it's been frustrating missing out on British Nationality, it's benefits and it's sense of pride all these years simply because every time I have approached the issue and contemplated the lengthy forms & the processing time, the costs etc., I am left shocked and put off each year by the ever increasing fees, which has gone from £60 in 1997 to £2357 in 2016.

attributes.action: Reduce Care Home fees and offer more help to the elderly
attributes.background:
Some elderly people pay almost £1000 a week for a care home. 

£1000 is too much for the elderly to afford in their last years. They should use that money for the things they want, and not an over priced bed.

attributes.action: Stop the advertising of alcohol.
attributes.background: People struggling with alcohol addiction face many daily struggles be it from withdrawals, anxiety, panic attacks. The list goes on, advertising of alcohol can often be a major trigger for someone suffering from alcohol dependencies when trying to remain abstinent.

attributes.action: Make it law that you have to move out of the way for emergency services.
attributes.background: I have seen a video in germany where they all move out of the way and make a space for the emergency services to get through easier and quicker. So by law I think we should have to do this in england.

attributes.action: Include school trips within 'childcare,' allowing payment by childcare vouchers
attributes.background: Childcare vouchers save working parents up to £935 each. At present, vouchers can be used for anything deemed as 'qualifying care,' however school trips do not currently fit within that criteria. Making it easier for parents to afford these expenses will allow more children access to these trips.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst childcare - under the 2006 childcare act - excludes care given during the school hours. I argue that residential trips, domestic or international, are beyond the remit of school care so should be categorised as 'qualifying care' and eligible for payment via voucher.

attributes.action: Improve rights of cohabiting unmarried women after a relationship breakdown
attributes.background: A married woman forced to leave her husband due to domestic violence is generally entitled to 50% of the couple's assets whereas an unmarried woman is entitled to nothing other than pitiful maintenance payments for her children but nothing for herself.
attributes.additional_details: It is ridiculous that, in this day and age, just because a cohabiting couple have not gone through a 30 minute marriage ceremony, the entitlement after a split to the assets they have accumulated together is completely different than in the case of if they are married. Invariably the woman, who often will be forced to leave with her children due to her partner's behaviour, will lose out. Scotland changed its laws in 2005 to give equal protection for cohabiting women, so why can't we do the same?

attributes.action: Free dental treatment for tax payers who pay into the nhs
attributes.background: I'm fed up for having to pay for dental treatment even though I pay my tax every month in which some of it goes into the NHS. Why should people on job seekers allowance etc get free dental care and treatment however us tax payers that support funding for the NHS have to pay.

attributes.action: Reverse any law that currently bans sale and/or posession of research chemicals.
attributes.background: It should be the choice of an individual to buy, and to use research chemicals according to their own will.

attributes.action: Make Schools In Britain Serve More Healthier Food To Students.
attributes.background: Lately, I've seen in various school canteens a lot of greasy food like pizzas, waffles, cakes with lots of sugary stuff etc. If you want the students to achieve more in the UK, then you should make the schools serve more healthier food.

attributes.action: Theresa May: Reverse the crippling cuts to local government
attributes.background: In recent years annual reductions in the grant paid by central government have crippled local authorities’ ability to respond effectively to local needs. Local government has borne a disproportionate share of central government’s austerity measures and it is now time to say "no more".
attributes.additional_details: In Eastbourne this has amounted to a savage reduction of almost 60% of the grant - £6m p/a. We call upon Eastbourne’s MP and MPs from across the country to lobby the Prime Minister and the government for a better settlement and to continue to do so until such time that funding for local authoroties reaches the level it was pre-2015. Whilst the petition originates in Eastbourne, it draws attention to the impact of government grant cuts to local authorities across England.

attributes.action: Ban the use of strobing front lights on cycles as it is off-putting for drivers.
attributes.background: Cycles have extremely bright flashing lights which can cause drivers at night to lose concentration and cause accidents. I understand they have to be seen but high level strobing lights is more dangerous to other road users.

attributes.action: Full time students should be included in the 30hrs free childcare for 3-4yr olds
attributes.background: Currently parents working full time are entitled to 30hours free childcare for 3-4yr olds,whilst students are entitled to only 15hrs.The cost of childcare has to be funded by grants and loans,there isn't enough money to cover basic living and childcare.Childcare should not be a barrier to learning.

attributes.action: Please exempt students of EU nationality from the CSI requirement
attributes.background:
Please exempt students holding EU nationality from the requirement of having comprehensive sickness insurance when applying for permanent residency document.
Most of us are in their 20s, healthy, and been living in the UK most of our life. No one really knew about this requirement until recently.
attributes.additional_details:
Most of us, despite often speaking better English than our parents' language, realise that we are not eligible to residency documents because of CSI requirement only when our application gets rejected.

https://www.gov.uk/eea-registration-certificate/permanent-residence
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39014191
https://www.freemovement.org.uk/comprehensive-sickness-insurance-what-is-it-and-who-needs-it/

attributes.action: Primary & secondary school teachers should be paid a minimum of £25,000 PA
attributes.background: Teaching is crucial in getting children the best learning and teachers are not paid enough for the amount of work they do. They should be paid a minimum of £25,000 with it to raise to £30,000 a year minimum after 3 years at the same school. This will help teachers become more stable at 1 school.

attributes.action: People who get ill because of drug abuse, and obesity should pay healthcare.
attributes.background: Drug abuse and alcoholism cost the N.H.S. £3.5 billion a year each, smoking costs £5 billion a year, and obesity £6.5 billion a year. That is £15 billion altogether. That means taxpayer is being forced to hand £500 to help those who don't help themselves. This must end.

attributes.action: Consider moving Britain’s Parliament to Manchester
attributes.background: As a solution to the problem of the eye watering expense of renovating The Palace of Westminster
attributes.additional_details: http://www.economist.com/blogs/bagehot/2017/02/go-north

attributes.action: Longer prison sentences for rape, murder and serious crimes.
attributes.background: A 23-year-old man was lured to a park and beaten for several hours and later died,The murderers were given 20 & 21 yrs. A man has been jailed for 12 years after he attacked a woman so badly that her face became completely detached from her skull. Given 12 yrs. NOT LONG ENOUGH!
attributes.additional_details: We keep getting told that our prisons are over crowded! they may well be, but how many of those offer no threat to the general public? let them out and get them doing work for the community and free the beds for the rapist, murders and child sex offenders that we want off our streets so it can be a safer place to bring a family up in. And then give longer sentences to these offenders and that might deter others, and they will think twice before reoffending. Then our prisons will have vacancies.

attributes.action: Both Parents assumed Equal parental rights(50 50) unless safeguarding issue .
attributes.background: The continued removal of loving parents through the family courts when one party has less rights, I believe is putting strain on our society as its causing the parents and the children mental health issues( such as self esteem), which in the long term is having a detrimental impact on our nation.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties against Hash smoking or possession
attributes.background: I am a London resident who has to deal with hash smokers every day. These people aren't like weed smokers, they are so much worse. The hash smells so much and stinks my building up, plus the hash they're smoking is mostly rubber and mud and it does horrible things to their bodies unlike weed smoke.

attributes.action: Legislate Against the Selling or Gifting of Customer Details
attributes.background:
Nearly all companies offer to "send me details of products and offers from third party organisations recommended by [the company]".

While it's very nice of them to offer this, the onus should be on the customer to sign up to these other companies, rather than our details be sold on for profit.
attributes.additional_details:
Let's face it, nobody wants their details sold or gifted to another company only to be written to and persuaded to purchase other goods or services that are by and large unwanted.

This legislation would eradicate the many double-negative tick boxes when forced to create accounts online and ultimately help individuals know EXACTLY which companies have their details.

attributes.action: Student phones to be given in to staff in all lessons in schools and  colleges.
attributes.background: Use of smart phones is increasingly interrupting learning, students constantly text friends and use social media during lessons which impacts on their learning and distracts others. Teachers need government support to require educational establishments to ensure phones are handed in to avoid this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/may/16/schools-mobile-phones-academic-results
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/impact-of-smartphones-on-behaviour-in-lessons-to-be-reviewed

attributes.action: Close time-based versus process-based loophole in Local Government Act 1974
attributes.background: The Local Government Act 1974 currently requires the complaints process at local level to be fully exhausted before cases are brought to the Local Government Ombudsman. The Local Government Ombudsman will not investigate cases that are more than 12 months' old. These constraints can be incompatible.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition originates from a planning application submitted to a local authority.

Objection to the application was submitted and the planning authority admitted procedural error; however granted permission to the applicant. The decision was complained about on the basis of a procedural impropriety however the planning authority refused to quash their decision.

An escalation to the Local Government Ombudsman was declined on the basis of time, even though the complaints process was followed.

attributes.action: Replace number plates with a road-tax disk like bar code
attributes.background: Many people do not like the look of number plates due to the bulky look & on many new cars, they do not seem to match aesthetically. Also, number plates can be stolen easily however with a tax-disk like sticker it is harder. It would reduce the amount of number plate thefts; assisting the police.
attributes.additional_details: For police investigation, they can read it like a number plate and it will come up on the police computer with all of the vehicles details.

attributes.action: Discontinue the practice of Prime Minister's Questions
attributes.background:
The ongoing insult to the UK citizens intelligence every Wednesday in Parliament due to the dishonesty and insult hurling which has become the norm under recent Prime Ministers. 
The establishment of  rules and disciplines are needed to allow this to become a meaningful and accountable process.

attributes.action: Legislation to require financial entities to consider fairly all applicants
attributes.background: With a large number of migrants currently living in the UK whom are unable to register in the Electoral Roll. I consider is discriminatory to have a negative impact in the credit report due to this factor. Many financial institutions will deny services without 3 years of UK address history.
attributes.additional_details: To be fair foreign address history should be considered or the address history requirement be limited to only the last UK address. If a person is not registered on the Electoral Roll can experience delays when applying for credit, and firms may turn down the application flatly if they can’t confirm where the person lives. An alternative, open register should be available to legal residents of the UK, in order for credit scoring companies and other financial institutions can confirm addresses.

attributes.action: Electric Cars should make a significant noise when moving for safety
attributes.background: We teach "stop, look and LISTEN" when teaching the green cross code. Also for people who rely on their sense of hearing to get about, electric cars are dangerous as they may believe the road to be clear when it is not. The sounds of conventional cars are a big part in keeping people safe
attributes.additional_details: The solution would be as simply as placing a wind (or in this case movement) activated noise maker on the roof of the car. This is just a suggestion of course, the important part is to make electric and hybrid automobiles make a noise like a conventional car does to alert pedestrians to their presence.

attributes.action: Make the Dartford crossing free if we are delayed by more than 5 minutes
attributes.background: Every day people who are just trying to get to work are held up at the Dartford crossing.  Once this starts costing the government rather than the working person things will change
attributes.additional_details: Every day I am held up there for some reason or another. You have the technology to see if we're going too fast now use it to see if we're going too slow.the crossing should be free if more than 5 minutes is added to our journey unless there is an accident

attributes.action: Make the Dartford crossing free of charge anytime of the day
attributes.background: The dartford crossing is a major road crossing of the River Thames in England, carrying the A282 road between Dartford in Kent to the south with Thurrock in Essex to the north. Make it for free for anyone to use 24 hours a day 7 days a week
attributes.additional_details: The Dartford crossing should be free for anyone to use the current charge for it is 2.50 but is for free from 10pm-6pm make it free for any one to use 24 hours a day and 7 days a week

attributes.action: Ban airlines' seat allocation fees for families
attributes.background: Nowadays marketing is getting mad and air companies are trying to get more monies from people for needless services, where there should a must. Children and families are paying nearly £100 extra to be sure that they will sit together with their children or relatives, husbands, wife on airplanes.
attributes.additional_details:
This fee must be banned for families, as this is extra money on top of the paid charges for holidays, which already cost a lot. 
Air companies are making money from nothing.

attributes.action: No exemption of neutralisation fee for residents - Equal and fair Treatment
attributes.background:
Everyone should be treated equally and fairly. 
If any nation is exempted everyone should be exempted and refunded accordingly. 
It's the policy of state, cannot be a favour.
attributes.additional_details:
Polish national are asking for exemption of Neturalisation fee which I see very unfair to other UK Residence permit holders.

All residents must be weight in same scale. 
Britain ruled most of works alone and can stand strong on its own feet.
Britain is not dependent on any nation.

attributes.action: Give more advice and provide help for free to the parents of obese children.
attributes.background: Children who are obese have higher risks of heart disease and other illnesses so it would be very important to lower the numbers of kids who are in need of help. Providing more help by making their parents aware of this and sending them free leaflets on how to help their child(ren) would be helpful.
attributes.additional_details: The number of obese children would change dramatically and fall if further support was given to parents or careers of children. Obesity levels in the UK are really high compared to other European countries and the world. Meal plans, guidance and leaflets with facts on obesity should be given to parents or careers so they can help their child lose weight and decrease chances of breathing difficulty, high blood pressure or a stroke in the future.

attributes.action: Nobody should be able to contest a Will.
attributes.background: If someone makes a Will when of sound mind then their wishes should be respected. If Wills can be contested then what is the point in paying a solicitor to write one in the first place?

attributes.action: Force any MP or someone standing as an MP, caught lying, to resign
attributes.background:
Any MP or someone standing as an MP who is caught blatantly lying for personal or political gain or for any reason to resign and never be allowed to stand again as an MP
We the people deserve trustworthy MPs and candidates

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people who have life saving medication.
attributes.background: People who have to pay for prescriptions when they have to take medication for life is wrong. They can't afford it and it is a necessity for them. If they can't afford it, it could mean life or death for them. It's wrong it should be free!

attributes.action: Allow Motorcross bikes to ride in public parks or fields
attributes.background: Allow Motorcross bikes to be ridden in fields or parks instead of being chased by police

attributes.action: Canadian citizens should be allowed to live in the UK without a residence visa.
attributes.background: Canadians have the oath to The Queen. The UK government should consider Canadians as their fellow home citizens. Canadians should not be treated as foreigners and I believe they should not be restricted to live in their second home by holding a residence visa!
attributes.additional_details: Canadian banknotes, coins, visas and many of the other legal identities have a picture of The Queen.

attributes.action: Chain restaurants and cafes have to offer blue badge tables for wheelchair users
attributes.background: It should be a legal requirement for large chain restaurants and cafes to have a blue badge table, where wheelchair bound citizens feel as though they can be comfortable and not in the way.
attributes.additional_details:
My mother recently suffered a stroke and is now wheelchair bound. As a strong independent woman, she has lost alot yet loves to enjoy a nice meal or coffee on a day out. However many times we will enter a restaurant or cafe to find that their isn't a spot or enough space. This means a simple journey to a cafe can lead to looking through 3 or 4 different ones. 

In 2017, this should not be an issue, parking is supplied for the less abled, this should be a legal requirement.

attributes.action: Protect our Public parks in England under threat from spending cuts.
attributes.background:
The future of many public parks has reached a "tipping point" with budgets to maintain them being cut by up to 97%.
A report by the Communities and Local Government Committee warns that the squeeze will mean that some parks face a return to the neglect they suffered in the 1980s and 1990s.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact of the cuts includes reduced opening hours, an increase in litter, the removal of play equipment, public toilets being shut, a rise in vandalism and an increase in the number of rats.

The report says that despite the benefit of public parks, most councils have cut budgets in recent years and further reductions are expected.

attributes.action: Public sector Pension to transfer to partner without the need to be married.
attributes.background: More and more people choose to live together without feeling the need to marry. However we still have certain pension company's that still refuse to recognise that you exist as a loving and committed couple if you don't marry. This needs to change. Please sign and show your support.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently a high court ruling of a case in Ireland was won by a widower. They had been a couple for 10 years and had recently become engaged. Tragically her fiancé died at 43 years old. She was then told by the pension company that she wouldn't be eligible to claim his pension due to not being married. She then had to fight and with the support of a crowd funding page
successfully won her case.

attributes.action: Designate certain careers as a 'Public Service Vocation' with specific benefits.
attributes.background: Doctors, nurses, teachers, the military, social workers and prison officers work, primarily, to provide and care for others and are not driven by financial rewards. This should be recognized by designating certain jobs as a 'Public Service Vocation' with enhanced benefits.
attributes.additional_details: Those who in the caring professions work selflessly in the community in schools, hospitals, prisons and in the armed forces. As they are not working for their own benefit and cannot, in the majority of cases, enhance their own pay packet by working any harder, they deserve special status in the tax system. They also deserve an entitlement to extended breaks in their working lives for rest and professional development so that they do not get 'burnt out' but enjoy long and fruitful careers.

attributes.action: Scrap the NHS.
attributes.background:
The NHS is costing too much money.
People don't need other people's money to pay for their healthcare.
People should have to get private health insurance so they're always covered.
The government should only provide it for those who can't afford insurance or can't get it for any other reason.
attributes.additional_details:
The following is statistical and anecdotal evidence that private healthcare works better than that which is provided by the government.
In the United States (which has private healthcare system), they have three times as many mammograms per person than in Europe.
3.7 million people are currently waiting for healthcare.
In Essex, doctors twice cancelled potentially life-saving surgery for a patient with oesophageal cancer because there were no free beds in the intensive care unit.

attributes.action: Offer a National Savings & Investments Product that pays a 6% interest rate.
attributes.background: 21 Million Savers have again sustained a new blow, following National Savings interest rates recently being cut by up to 0.25 per cent.The Prime Minister, The Rt. Hon. Theresa May, had "pledged" to help those battered by record low interest rates, which have remained at a record low since 2008.
attributes.additional_details: On the one hand the Government maintains that it wants to champion Savers, yet on the other, it continues to cut rates.Savers have been punished time and time again.The Prime Minister has warned that rock bottom rates and quantitative easing had "bad side effects", including "making Savers poorer". She also stated " A change has got to come and we are going to deliver it". So please deliver it.The Government should offer through NS&I, a Savings Product which pays an interest rate of at least 6%.

attributes.action: Provide student loans for British students having to study abroad
attributes.background: Studying abroad is financially challenging, especially with the lack of support from your own country. Foreign students studying in England benefit from a student loan system, but British students studying abroad do not. The government should provide a student loans system for all British students.

attributes.action: Prevent owners taking their horses on main roads especially during peak hours.
attributes.background: Stop allowing horses to be ridden or pull a cart on main roads. Horses on main roads can cause serious danger and distress to the horse due to fast moving, loud vehicles. It can also cause major distruption for motorists who are often unable to over-take which can lead to queue build up.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 incidents involving horses ends in a fatality for individuals and almost always for the horse. Although accidents involving horses are not required to be recorded as an official incident, unless a person is injured, it happens quite frequently and can be traumatising for both horse owners and motorists. 
In the past, I have witnessed a horse being hit on a busy main road. The horse was badly injured and died at the scene. The owner of the horse was also injured and extremely traumatised.

attributes.action: Benefits for people who are diagnosed with mental health problems.
attributes.background: People who are diagnosed with life long mental health issues, that affect there quality of life, should not be discriminated, it is hard as it is to find and get support when you are diagnosed with mental health problems.
attributes.additional_details: People with mental health issues should be supported by the goverment, and evaluated to see if they are fit to work. There quality of life is much different, and  the goverment lacks the understanding of mental health conditions. It's is near impossible for somone with Bi-polar, ADHD or autisim to find work and should not be left abandoned by the goverment.

attributes.action: Make the Help to Buy 40% allowance available outside London in expensive areas
attributes.background: An interest free loan is available from the government for 5 years on a new build home. This is 40% in London and 20% outside London. Some areas of the UK, for example the South East, have house prices similar to London. In these areas the help should be proportionate.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Justine Greening, Secretary of State for Education
attributes.background: Since Justine Greening was appointed as Secretary of State for Education and Minister for Women and Equalities she has neglected to fulfil her responsibilities and to ensure that the DfE obtain all records/evidence in complaints against schools/governing bodies. Currently the DfE does not do this
attributes.additional_details: The Department of Education doesn’t obtain records when parents/students make a complaint against a school/governing body or other authorities if involved. It is vital for complaints where the school/governing body are not providing records/evidence that the DfE must obtain and forward them to the complainant to contribute. Student’s education is put at risk & their records contaminated with misleading information. The DfE complaints system must be overhauled & those responsible held accountable

attributes.action: Allocate funding for researching the possible treatments of Misophonia
attributes.background: Ryan Simpson is just one of many unfortunate people, whom have an abnormality in their nervous system that will cause them to be triggered by certain noises that others don't even hear. I ask the government to allocate funding to research a cure for this dreadful condition.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.itv.com/news/2017-02-03/scientists-discover-why-noisy-eating-can-make-people-angry/

attributes.action: Pay for free access to M6 Toll during planned roadworks on the M5/M6 this year.
attributes.background: The M5 viaduct between junctions 1 and 2 is being repaired this year. Each carriageway will be closed in turn to allow the deck to be replaced causing the liability of severe congestion. This will back up in both directions. Add repairs to M6 junction 7 and the likelihood is chaos.
attributes.additional_details:
Opening the M6 Toll would take some of the pressure off the M6 for traffic heading to London and other south eastern areas, and off the M5 as traffic could head round the M42.

The costs to the economy of traffic being delayed will be huge.

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/highways-england-begins-vital-maintenance-work-on-m6

http://www.expressandstar.com/news/transport-news/2016/11/14/m5-roadworks-motorists-facing-months-of-misery-with-repairs-planned-to-crumbling-viaduct/

attributes.action: Sociology should be taught across all key stages, starting from primary school
attributes.background: Sociology is fundamental in understanding our social world, and this gives the opportunity to develop critical thinking skills.This is a positive thing, as people can share their views and in doing this, improving society. Sociology is important as it explains our functioning in daily life.
attributes.additional_details: 'I had always looked down on sociology as this arriviste discipline. It didn't have the noble history of English and history as a subject. But once I had a little exposure to it, I said, 'Hey, here's the key. Here's the key to understanding life and all its forms.' Tom Wolfe
